abstract: Federal government files documents supporting cases of Sara Weckhorst and Tessa Farmer, two students who filed federal lawsuits arguing Kansas State University policy not to investigate rape allegations in off-campus fraternities violates Title IX civil rights statute prohibiting sex discrimination; government statements disagree with university's assertion that cases should be dismissed, since school is not legally responsible for off-campus student-on-student rape.

headline.print_headline: University Told to Heed Rape Claims Off Campus
headline.main: U.S. Urges Kansas State to Heed Reports of Off-Campus Rape

snippet: A university policy not to investigate reports of rape off campus violates Title IX, the government said in documents supporting two women’s cases....
lead_paragraph: A university policy not to investigate reports of rape off campus violates Title IX, the government said in documents supporting two women’s cases.
